alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Panola; Rusk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SMITH...SOUTHWESTERN PANOLA...RUSK...NACOGDOCHES...WESTERN ANGELINA AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 300 AM CDT... At 152 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coon Creek Lake, or 13 miles south of Athens, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Lufkin, Nacogdoches, Jacksonville, Henderson, Whitehouse, Rusk, Diboll, Hudson, Chandler, Overton, Bullard, Huntington, Troup, Alto, New London, Arp, Garrison, Wells, and Pinehill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
